meanings.definition: The process of adopting or influencing Western culture, customs, or practices.
meanings.sent1: The westernisation of their traditional clothing was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent2: Many countries have embraced westernisation in order to keep up with global trends.
meanings.sent3: The sudden westernisation of the small town's cuisine left the locals both curious and confused.
meanings.sent4: Her music had a subtle touch of westernisation, blending traditional melodies with modern beats.
meanings.sent5: The school's curriculum underwent a gradual westernisation, incorporating new subjects and teaching methods.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more Western in style or character.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer focused on the westernisation of the restaurant, adding rustic elements and cowboy motifs.
meanings.sent2: The film director aimed for a subtle westernisation of the movie set to enhance the authenticity of the story.
meanings.sent3: The westernisation of the old building's architecture gave it a fresh and modern look.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion line featured a unique blend of eastern and western influences, creating a striking westernisation of style.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting showcased a bold westernisation of colors, combining vibrant hues with traditional themes.
